sources.data_found: VACC Knowledge Base (Cached/Public snippet): Confirms DeepGreen nodes utilize NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs.

student_data.notes: Official department 'About' page states 'over 600 undergraduate majors and 70 graduate students'. The graduate total (70) was split into MS and PhD estimates based on IPEDS/OIR completion data which shows roughly 20-25 MS degrees awarded annually (implying ~45 enrolled MS students), leaving ~25 PhD students. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: Primary research cluster is 'DeepGreen'. Launch specifications confirm 80 NVIDIA V100 GPUs. No public documentation was found regarding a 'Phase 2' expansion to A100 or H100 hardware as of mid-2025; UVM Research Computing likely utilizes national ACCESS resources for higher-tier compute needs. Previous clusters (Black Diamond, Bluemoon) are retired. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

compute_credits.description: No specific cloud compute credit programs listed.

analysis_notes: UVM relies on a single major local cluster (DeepGreen) launched circa 2019/2020. Student numbers are derived from the department's explicit 'By the Numbers' statement.
